summary: Ambrosia trifida,  the giant ragweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to North America, where it is widespread in Canada, the United States, and northern Mexico.

flower.description: It is monoecious and the small capitulum forming raceme is infertile and male, and each capitulum consists of about 15 common flowers. Their guns are dish-shaped with a diameter of 5 mm. The female flower is a fertile head flower, and it is gathered in the leaf axil of the bract and is a top or obovate shape.

shape.stem: It is erect by extending underground stems. It has many branches and coarse hairs.
shape.leaf: The outline is oval or broadly ovate, reaching 20-30 cm in length and width, with 3-5 rows. Lobes have serrated edges and coarse hairs on both sides.
shape.fruit: 6-12mm long, 4-5mm wide, ovate, with 5-7 ridges, with a small hump at the top of each ridge.
